names.Ahmed: A name meaning 'greatly praised' and one of the names of the Prophet Muhammad.
names.Mohammed: The most common name in the world, it translates to 'praiseworthy' or 'lauded'.
names.Youssef: The Arabic form of Joseph, meaning 'God increases' or 'God will add'.
names.Said: A cheerful name that literally translates to 'happy' or 'lucky'.
names.Amine: Refers to someone who is 'trustworthy', 'honest', or 'faithful'.
names.Mehdi: A spiritual name meaning 'the rightly guided one'.
names.Hicham: An ancient name meaning 'generous' or 'one who smashes bread' (a sign of hospitality).
names.Mostapha: One of the titles of the Prophet, meaning 'the chosen one'.
names.Yassine: The name of a chapter in the Quran, often used as a title for the Prophet.
names.Brahim: A regional variation of Ibrahim, meaning 'father of many' or 'father of nations'.
names.Hamza: Meaning 'lion' or 'strong and steadfast', it was the name of the Prophet's uncle.
names.Ayoub: The Arabic version of Job, symbolizing 'patience' and 'returning to God'.
names.Anass: A friendly name meaning 'affectionate', 'sociable', or 'pleasant company'.
names.Samir: A poetic name referring to a 'companion in evening talk'.
names.Idriss: Thought to mean 'to study' or 'interpreter', often associated with the prophet Enoch.
names.Bilal: Meaning 'moisture' or 'refreshing', it was the name of the first Muezzin in Islam.
names.Jawad: Refers to someone who is 'generous', 'magnanimous', or 'open-handed'.
names.Larbi: Common in North Africa, it simply means 'the Arab' or 'Arabic'.
names.Oussama: A classic Arabic name for a 'lion'.
names.Amjad: A superlative name meaning 'more glorious' or 'most illustrious'.
names.Adam: The first human, meaning 'man' or 'made from the earth'.
names.Alaeddine: Meaning 'excellence of the faith' or 'nobility of religion'.
names.El Houssine: A diminutive of Hassan, meaning 'little handsome one' or 'beautiful'.
names.Anys: A name for a 'close companion' or someone who is 'genial'.
names.Fouad: A poetic term specifically referring to the 'heart' or 'spirit'.
names.Fadi: A title meaning 'the savior' or 'the redeemer'.
names.Wail: Meaning 'one who seeks shelter' or 'returning to peace'.
names.Ilyas: The Arabic form of Elijah, meaning 'My God is Yahweh'.
names.Nouh: The Arabic form of Noah, meaning 'rest' or 'comfort'.
names.Wassim: Refers to someone who is 'graceful' or 'distinguished in appearance'.
names.Karim: One of the 99 names of God, meaning 'generous' or 'noble'.
names.Redouan: Meaning 'satisfaction', 'pleasure', or 'the keeper of the gates of heaven'.
names.Abdollah: A humble name meaning 'servant of God'.
names.Youness: The Arabic version of Jonah, meaning 'dove'.
names.Faysal: Meaning 'a decisive leader' or 'one who separates truth from falsehood'.
names.Hamid: A name meaning 'praiseworthy' or 'one who praises'.
names.Rayan: Meaning 'luxuriant' or 'well-watered', it is the name of a gate in Paradise.
names.Tarik: Often translated as 'the morning star' or 'one who knocks at the door'.
names.Mouad: Meaning 'protected' or 'one who is under God's protection'.
names.Najib: Refers to someone of 'noble birth' or an 'intelligent' person.
names.Hakim: A name for a 'wise man' or a 'physician'.
names.Reda: Meaning 'contentment', 'satisfaction', or 'being pleased with God’s will'.
names.Bassam: A cheerful name meaning 'one who smiles often'.
names.Bouchaib: A traditional Moroccan name likely referring to 'the one with many young ones'.
names.Abdelilah: A religious name meaning 'servant of the Deity'.
names.Abdesalam: A peaceful name meaning 'servant of Peace'.
names.Abdelmalek: Meaning 'servant of the King' or 'servant of the Sovereign'.
names.Saif: A sharp and strong name meaning 'sword'.
names.Rayad: A variation of Riyadh, meaning 'gardens' or 'meadows'.
names.Nasser: A strong name meaning 'victorious' or 'grantor of victory'.
names.Chafik: Refers to someone who is 'compassionate', 'kind', or 'tender'.
names.Fariss: A name for a 'knight', 'horseman', or 'perspicacious person'.
names.Azzedine: Meaning 'the might of the faith' or 'power of religion'.
names.Imrane: Refers to 'prosperity' and 'long-life', also the name of Mary’s father in the Quran.
names.Nourdine: A radiant name meaning 'light of the religion'.
names.Rida: A variation of Reda, meaning 'contentment' or 'approval'.
names.Nizar: An old name meaning 'little' or 'scarce', historically tied to nobility.
names.Chouaib: The name of a prophet, often associated with 'excellence' or 'showing the way'.
names.Elmahjoub: Meaning 'the hidden one' or 'the veiled one'.
names.Marwan: A name referring to 'flintstone' or 'a fragrant herb'.
names.Awss: An ancient tribal name meaning 'gift' or 'wolf'.
names.Wissam: A name meaning 'medal', 'badge of honor', or 'distinction'.
